messages: ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (07:01): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: when you say and i think we should have a principle that says that existing practices, where harmless or beneficial, should be adopted, rather than trying to swim upstream for purely theoretical reasons -- I think there are already two design principles that cover that: support existing content and save the cowpaths
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (07:01): the trick is to get folks to agree with the basic premise underlying all
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (07:02): I think that if we acknowledge that browser makers have to render existing material, and that spec organizations have two roles:
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:03): ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc: i was saying that as a suggestion to split the "pave the cowpaths" principle in three

ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (07:03): providing guidance to browser makers so that authors don't need to write code four times AND providing guidance to authors so that best practices start to emerge
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (07:03): then there may not be any disagreement
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:04): i was just talking about the author side
